result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle J Needham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay $450.00 fine and court costs. Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
------------------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
------------------------------------

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle J Needham

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kyle J Needham in court. Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant plead guilty. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty.  Defendant does not make statement. Court gives warning to deportation. Restitution held open for 30 days. Court sentences defendant. Minutes filed.

Defendant Kyle J Needham in court.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for SPD. Not guilty plea entered by court and trial reserved. Bond amended to reflect correct DOBs of victims. Attorney waived. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDED 9/9/2022: Victims' birthdates corrected. 

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH R.R.S. dob 10-24-1927 or J.C.F. dob 8-13-1977 or PROPERTY. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Kyle J Needham in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Complaint read by court. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
